briefdescription.para: Callback type for fill-mode replica construction.

detaileddescription.para:
The callback is invoked once per socket after:
the current thread has been (best-effort) bound to that socket,
memory has been allocated and first-touched for locality.
The callback must fully initialize the provided destination buffer.

parameterdescription.para: User context pointer provided to the builder.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative errno-like on failure.

briefdescription.para: First-touch a writable buffer to bias NUMA page placement.

detaileddescription.para: Writes one byte per cache line across the region to ensure resident pages are backed by the NUMA node of the current CPU affinity.

briefdescription.para: Best-effort hint to the OS that the buffer will be needed soon.

detaileddescription.para: Uses POSIX readahead/madvise when available. If the platform does not expose a declaration for posix_madvise (or the specific advice constant), this function degrades to a no-op.

briefdescription.para: Best-effort hint to the OS that sequential access is expected.

detaileddescription.para: This can help some kernels choose better readahead / paging heuristics.

briefdescription.para: Allocate a replica buffer and establish locality via first-touch.

simplesect.para: Pointer to allocated memory, or NULL on failure.

briefdescription.para: Free all allocations owned by a replica set (internal helper).

memberdef.argsstring: (const ie_topology_t *topo, int n_sockets, const void *blob, size_t blob_size, ie_hot_replicas_t **out)
memberdef.name: ie_hot_replicate_build

briefdescription.para: Create per-socket replicas of blob using first-touch placement (copy mode).

detaileddescription.para: For each socket: 1) bind to that socket via ie_topology_bind_thread_to_socket(); 2) allocate replica memory and first-touch it; 3) memcpy() the source blob; 4) hint the kernel that pages will be needed (best-effort).
This is a good default when the source blob is small enough or already hot, and when you do not have a better per-socket fill path.

parameterdescription.para: Sockets to build (if <= 0, derived from topo; if topo is NULL or invalid, defaults to 1).
Output pointer to receive the replicas object (non-NULL).

simplesect.para: 0 on success; negative errno-like on failure.

memberdef.argsstring: (const ie_topology_t *topo, int n_sockets, size_t replica_size, ie_hot_replica_fill_fn fill, void *user, ie_hot_replicas_t **out)
memberdef.name: ie_hot_replicate_build_fill

briefdescription.para: Create per-socket replicas using a caller-provided fill callback (fill mode).

detaileddescription.para: This is the preferred mode for Step-3 persistent reconstruction: you can reconstruct/assemble the "hot weights blob" directly into the local per-socket replica after first-touch, avoiding cross-socket memcpy traffic.

For each socket: 1) bind to that socket via ie_topology_bind_thread_to_socket(); 2) allocate replica memory and first-touch it; 3) call fill(socket_id, replica_ptr, replica_size, user); 4) hint the kernel that pages will be needed (best-effort).

parameterdescription.para: Sockets to build (if <= 0, derived from topo; if topo is NULL or invalid, defaults to 1).
Size in bytes of each replica (> 0).
Callback to populate each per-socket replica (non-NULL).
Opaque user pointer passed to fill.
Output pointer to receive the replicas object (non-NULL).

simplesect.para: 0 on success; negative errno-like on failure.

briefdescription.para: Free replicas previously built by ie_hot_replicate_build() or ie_hot_replicate_build_fill().

detaileddescription.para: Releases all memory owned by the replica set.

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the replica pointer for a socket.

parameterdescription.para: Optional size return; may be NULL.

simplesect.para: Pointer to replica memory or NULL on error.

briefdescription.para: Convenience: memcpy() into a given socketâ€™s replica.

detaileddescription.para: Copies exactly the size of the existing replica buffer for socket_id.

parameterdescription.para: Source bytes (non-NULL). Must be at least replica size.

simplesect.para: 0 on success; -EINVAL on bad args; -ENOBUFS if replica size is zero.

briefdescription.para: Replication of hot weight blobs per socket using first-touch placement.

detaileddescription.para: This module implements a small utility to create per-socket replicas of a contiguous "hot" blob so that the inference kernel can read local memory when threads are socket-pinned.

Step-3 (Runtime reconstruction path) integration:
This unit now supports two build modes: 1) Copy mode: replicate an existing source blob via memcpy(). 2) Fill mode: allocate per-socket memory, first-touch it, then let a caller-provided callback populate the replica in-place.

Fill mode exists to avoid a common NUMA pitfall:
If you reconstruct/assemble the hot blob once on socket 0 and then memcpy it to other sockets, you pay cross-socket bandwidth and potentially pull pages into the wrong node before first-touch.
The module depends on ie_topology.h for socket enumeration and thread binding. It does not define any thread-binding symbol by itself; it calls ie_topology_bind_thread_to_socket() from topology.c.
